perturbation.original_text: 1. The Term of the Agreement is hereby extended to January 20, 2012 unless sooner terminated as provided for in the Agreement. If the Agreement expired prior to the Amendment Effective Date, any orders received and Products and Services purchased between the date of expiration and the Amendment Effective Date shall be in all respects deemed made under the Agreement as in effect prior to this Amendment. The parties further agree that if Distributor places Purchase Orders after the expiration of the Agreement, and Cisco accepts such Purchase Orders, then any such Purchase Orders shall be governed by the terms and conditions of the Agreement; provided, however that acceptance by Cisco of any Purchase Order placed after the Agreement has expired will not be considered as an extension of the term of the Agreement nor a renewal thereof. Notwithstanding Cisco's right to extend the term of the Agreement, each party acknowledges that the Agreement shall always be interpreted as being limited in duration to a definite term and that the other party has made no commitments whatsoever regarding the renewal of the Agreement beyond those expressly agreed in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. The Term of the Agreement is hereby extended to January 20, 2012 unless sooner terminated as provided for in the Agreement. If the Agreement expired prior to the Amendment Effective Date, any orders received and Products and Services purchased between the date of expiration and the Amendment Effective Date shall be in all respects deemed made under the Agreement as in effect prior to this Amendment. The parties further agree that if Distributor places Purchase Orders after the expiration of the Agreement, and Cisco accepts such Purchase Orders, then any such Purchase Orders shall be governed by the terms and conditions of the Agreement; provided, however that acceptance by Cisco of any Purchase Order placed after the Agreement has expired will be considered as an automatic extension of the term of the Agreement. Notwithstanding Cisco's right to extend the term of the Agreement, each party acknowledges that the Agreement shall always be interpreted as being limited in duration to a definite term and that the other party has made no commitments whatsoever regarding the renewal of the Agreement beyond those expressly agreed in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that accepting Purchase Orders after expiration does *not* extend the agreement, while the modified text states it *does*, leading to a contradiction regarding the term's extension upon acceptance of purchase orders after expiry.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement, except for purchases made using promotional discounts. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Cisco. Distributor shall be entitled to return Product once per quarter, even if such returns exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be included in the calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the current market price of the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Balancing Cap is based on all product purchases, while the new text excludes purchases with promotional discounts.  It also changes responsibility for managing the cap to Cisco, removes the limit of the balancing cap for returns, includes DOA products for calculation of Balancing Cap, and changes the credited amount to current market price, leading to a contradiction with later sections that might depend on the original definition.

Originally, compliance with all laws was a strict requirement. Now, it's an effort-based clause ('will endeavor to comply'). Furthermore, distributor is now only responsible for violations if it benefits Cisco, conflicting with the intent of the original strict adherence and potentially creating loopholes in legal compliance if another part of the agreement enforces strict adherance.
